org.robolectric.shadows

Class ShadowRealisticLooper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.robolectric.shadows.ShadowBaseLooper
      • org.robolectric.shadows.ShadowRealisticLooper

  • @Implements(value=android.os.Looper.class,
            shadowPicker=ShadowBaseLooper.Picker.class,
            isInAndroidSdk=false)
public class ShadowRealisticLooper
extends ShadowBaseLooper

    A new variant of a Looper shadow that is active when ShadowBaseLooper.useRealisticLooper() is enabled.

    This shadow differs from the legacy ShadowLooper in the following ways:\ - Has no connection to Scheduler. Its APIs are standalone - The main looper is always paused. Posted messages are not executed unless idle() is called. - Just like in real Android, each looper has its own thread, and posted tasks get executed in that thread. - - There is only a single SystemClock value that all loopers read from. Unlike legacy behavior where each Scheduler kept their own clock value.

    This is beta API, and will very likely be renamed in a future Robolectric release. Its recommended to use ShadowBaseLooper instead of this type directly.

      • isIdle

        public boolean isIdle()
        Description copied from class: ShadowBaseLooper

        Returns true if looper has no pending tasks which are scheduled for execution at or before current time.

        Note this does NOT necessarily mean looper is not currently busy executing a task.

        Specified by:
        isIdle in class ShadowBaseLooper

      • runPaused

        public void runPaused(Runnable runnable)
        Description copied from class: ShadowBaseLooper

        Runs the current task with the looper paused.

        When LooperMode is PAUSED, this will execute all pending tasks scheduled before the current time.

        Specified by:
        runPaused in class ShadowBaseLooper

      • pause

        Description copied from class: ShadowBaseLooper
